column3: Thanks for this @danra , but I don't think whitespace-only PRs are required (they increase code-churn, take reviewer time and may cause rebases for other PRs), so I'd rather NACK this.
Tend to agree with @jnewbery. This is also mentioned in the developer notes.\n\nClosing this for now, unless someone has a strong opinion to the contrary.

@MarcoFalke Do you mean 
"Do not submit patches solely to modify the style of existing code."
from the developer notes?

While this change is trivial, its intention isn't to modify the style - it's to make the code more easily verifiable and therefore secure, e.g., there is no zero missing or an extra `f` stuck somewhere in the masks.

Yes, that is what I was referring to. Generally, it is preferred that style issues are addressed in pulls that touch the code for other reasons than formatting and style.\n\nEven though I understand your motivation, your change needs to be verified as well. This might be simple, but the overhead of a pull request over its whole life span is not negligible.
